description: Simple function as paste is behind premium plan..
425 MB RAM just from the first start. Ctrl+V is a paid feature. You kiddin' me.
summary: Electron devs would love this app

description: Has everything a good privacy note taking application should provide. Had issues in the past but after v3 was released everything went back to working. Still has issues with minimize to system tray in wayland.
summary: Good if you are looking for a notes app

description: Actually works on Linux with Flatpak! Love the privacy features too.

I've tried several other notetaking apps like Simplenote, Evernote, Notion, Standard Notes, ... Notesnook look the most promising. It's made primarily for taking notes, there's no additional bloat. I like the UI, simple yet powerfull editor, notes/notebooks/topics organization, encryption and it works offline. It's quite usable on free plan. A lot of features are only in paid plan, as well as unlimited storage, but $62 per year (including tax) for Pro plan is appropriate (if you want quality & privacy without adds, you must pay) and it's cheaper than the other apps. I really recommend Notesnook.

This team is laser focused on building the #1 note-taking tool that just happens to be the most secure. Open source with a well managed and viewable roadmap. I would pay twice the price for their premium service. Nice job guys!
summary: Rapidly becoming the premiere note-taking tool!

description: High quality notes app with polished UI. Works cross platform, syncs everything well. Feature rich. I use it to organize and publish notes and to manage my schedule.
even thou the product is new, it works very well across all operating systems. of course we want more features, I believe in time this product will be great than what it is now.
This has been my go-to private note-taking app for over a year now, and they consistently improve the feature set over time. It is E2EE and easy to use.
window snapping in gnome wayland kinda buggy, there's an open gap on the edge
summary: great app, works flawlessly accros devices

description: All of the notes app are beautiful and functional with modern features or is a text based FOSS version. Standard Notes has been the go to for years but this app has a more modern look, features for pdf or image upload, and is end to end encrypted. This team has been shipping like crazy for the last two years and have since open sourced their app so I gladly made the transition.

Unlike a lot of FOSS options out there, Notesnook has a mobile version on iOS and Android with full feature parity. It's similar to Apple Notes but significantly more customizable. You can use color schemes like Dracula or generate your own.
It's seems a very nice editor,wish it could support Asian languages such as Janpanese and Chinese
summary: Wish it can support Asian languages

description: I am happy to use this for notes. The sync. across devices works convenient (also in the free version), encryption is good & if you qualify for an educational discount the pricing is really nice...

Works Super great. FREE and Open Source

Well refined and reliable, yet sometimes workflow breaking due to expiring sessions which – well – are a security feature of a security focussed app. Overall great alternative to things like StandardNotes
Una aplicacion de notas, que es una excelente opción para aquellos que valoran la privacidad, es sencilla y fluida.
summary: Sencilla, fluida y con cifrado de extremo a extremo
